Facilitation payments are usually small payments or gifts made to public officials to perform their normal duty or function or to speed up their actions. They are often called grease payments because they speed up the process or “grease the wheels”.

A situation demanding a facilitation payment typically arises when dealing with government officials. Arrival in immigration halls, sending goods through  customs, crossing borders are all opportunities for facilitation payments to be demanded.
Facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
Facilitation payments are typically demanded by low level and low income Public Officials in exchange for providing services to which one is legally entitled without such payments.
